intro: Gonzalezia rosei, commonly known as the rose-flowered gonzalezia, is a species of flowering plant native to the Andean region of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, rose-like flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as mountain forests. Its ornamental value has made it a subject of interest for horticulturists and botanists alike.
